messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
>
>
> On 2/20/07, Ole Ersoy <ole_ersoy@...
> <mailto:ole_ersoy%40yahoo.com>> wrote:
>
> > Or do it in reverse.
> >
> > Declare private methods on the Class, and have the
> > builder create the ClassHelper.
>
> I'm a bit confused where this discussion is going.
>
> If my class needs helper methods that it will be the only one using, I
> make them private on that same class (ideally, static private if they
> don't modify any state).
>
> Only if these helper methods can be useful to other classes would I
> consider extracting them in a separate Helper class.

Indeed. It's a natural refactoring. Once I have 3 static private
methods, I consider moving them to another class, especially if they're
related. I usually just make 'em public and decide whether it makes
sense to make 'em instance-level instead. I find it easier to deal with
dependencies through objects than global methods.
